channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: craigslist Charitable Fund Donates $100,000 to The Perl Foundation
soma.fm command line interface
item.description: Adam Flott likes soma.fm, command line interface and Perl. Here he combines the 3.

item.title: Padre 0.94 has been released...
item.description: After another long pause Peter Lavender released a new version of Padre, the Perl IDE.

item.title: The Case of the Incompatible Safe
item.description: Tom Wyant asked C. Auguste Dupin again for help. This time with a conflict between Safe, Devel::Cover, Data::Dumper and eval. Unfortunately Dupin was just mocking him.

item.title: Using emacs as a perl IDE
item.description: Dave Hodgkinson asked for some links describing how people use Emacs as a perl IDE. This is the follow-up post with the links.

item.title: A Quick Pas de Deux with Dancer
item.description: Yanick Champoux (yanick) gets his hands dirty while he is trying to find his way out of a new file existence test.

item.title: Great Picture of Catalyst Dispatch Flow
Visualizing the Perl 5 support policy
item.description: This is a follow-up post by David Golden to his post about historical Perl 5 release cycles.

item.title: Video killed the presenting star...
item.description: Mark Keating recommends some video recordings from the London Perl Workshop 2011 and Perl Oasis 2012.

item.title: A Tale of CPAN Testers
item.description: Buddy Burden describes - in a very colorful way - the process of releasing a module to CPAN and how the CPAN tester results helped him save 3 cents.

item.title: Speed up Perlbrew with Test Parallelism
item.description: chromatic saves another few minutes while building perl. It's like the 'turbo' button on old PCs. I wonder why parallelism is NOT the default?

item.title: Text::APL - streaming and non-blocking Perl template engine
item.description: Viacheslav Tykhanovskyi (vti) introduces yet another templating engine.

item.title: Redis server in Perl
item.description: Sergey Zasenko (und3f) uses Protocol::Redis to build a simple Redis server.

item.title: I love MooseX::Role::Loggable
item.description: Sawyer X has married Log::Dispatchouli with Moose and you got a new role.

item.title: Rakudo Star 2012.01 released
item.description: This is the official release note of the Rakudo Star distribution of Perl 6. It includes the Rakudo Perl 6 compiler, the Parrot Virtual Machine and a number of Perl 6 modules.

item.title: This month's Rakudo Star release - and what's coming next
item.description: Jonathan Worthington gives his account on why this release is so important for him.

item.title: CodeMash 2012
item.description: As Brian Meeker reports, there was no Perl content at CodeMash 2012, something I hope will be fixed next year, but there were a number of other, interesting topics.

item.title: An Oslo.pm retrospective
item.description: If you are part of a Perl Mongers group and wondering how could you make it better, this article might give you some ideas.

item.title: How to get the Perl Weekly every day?
item.description: Luckily I recently started to share links to articles as I notice them. That already helps me put together the newsletter. If you are interested to follow, you can do it on Google+, Facebook or Twitter.

item.title: Perl Workshop in Israel
item.description: February 28, 2012, Ramat Gan, Israel

item.title: German Perl workshop
item.description: March 5-7, 2012, Erlangen, Germany

item.title: DC-Baltimore Perl workshop
item.description: April 14, 2012, Catonsville, MD, USA

item.title: YAPC::NA
item.description: June 13-15, 2012, Madison, Wisconsin, USA
